has.from sentence: We can observe that adding either attention guided layers or densely connected layers improves the performance of the model .

varied values of K.outperform: state - of - the - art C - GCN model

all the C - AGGCN models.from sentence: We can observe that all the C - AGGCN models with varied values of K are able to outperform the state - of - the - art C - GCN model ( reported in ) .

feed - forward layer.from sentence: We also notice that the feed - forward layer is effective in our model .

C - AGGCN with full trees.outperforms: all C - AGGCNs with pruned trees

performance.from sentence: In addition , we notice that the performance of C - AGGCN with full trees outperforms all C - AGGCNs with pruned trees .

feed - forward layer.from sentence: Without the feed - forward layer , the result drops to an F1 score of 67.8 .

C - AGGCN with full trees.from sentence: In general , C - AGGCN with full trees outperforms C - AGGCN with pruned trees and C - GCN against various sentence lengths .

improvement.from sentence: Moreover , the improvement achieved by C - AGGCN with pruned trees decays when the sentence length increases .

C - AGGCN.from sentence: C - AGGCN consistently outperforms C - GCN under the same amount of training data .
This suggests that C - AGGCN can benefit more from larger graphs ( full tree ) .

training data.from sentence: When the size of training data increases , we can observe that the performance gap becomes more obvious .
Particularly , using 80 % of the training data , the C - AGGCN model is able to achieve a F 1 score of 66.5 , higher than C - GCN trained on the whole dataset .
